parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the flying altitude for aircraft relatively to the ground surface. Avoid too low altitudes, as helicopters and planes won't evade trees and obstacles on the ground. The default flying altitude is 100 meters. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> aircraft [[flyInHeight]] altitude </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> aircraft: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> altitude: [[Number]] - flying altitude in meters </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_helicopter [[flyInHeight]] 40;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[flyInHeightASL]], [[swimInDepth]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on August 4, 2006 - 10:50
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]
<dd class="note">''Notes from before the conversion:''<br>
From <template><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>ofp</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.80</value></part></template> - [[flyInHeight]] now affects not only helicopters, but also planes.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 4, 2006 - 12:18
<dt class="note">[[User:UNN|UNN]]
<dd class="note">A plane's flyInHeight is restricted to a minimum of 20 meters.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 15, 2008 - 19:04
<dt class="note">[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]
<dd class="note">A [[flyInHeight]] of 0 will keep the chopper pinned to the ground, even when the engines have been started.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 00:53, 11 April 2009 (CEST)
<dt class="note">[[User:Jtgibson|Jtgibson]]
<dd class="note">If a helo has no waypoints, it will assume a low hover without regard to this setting.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
